meanings.definition: To make something appear kitschy or tacky.
meanings.sent1: She tried to kitschify her room by adding bright colors and quirky decorations.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to kitschify the old furniture by painting it in neon colors.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to kitschify the office with plastic flamingos and disco balls was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The party planner managed to kitschify the event space into a retro wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to kitschify the bland room into a vibrant and fun space.

meanings.definition: To decorate or design in a kitschy or tacky style.
meanings.sent1: They kitschified the cafe with vintage posters and mismatched furniture.
meanings.sent2: The shop owner decided to kitschify the storefront with colorful lights and oversized ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to kitschify the garden with gnomes and plastic flowers was a hit with visitors.
meanings.sent4: The designer managed to kitschify the runway with bold patterns and quirky accessories.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to kitschify the party venue with retro decorations and funky music.
